ygData.subject: Re: AC and weight...
ygData.msgSnippet: To be honest with you I reccomend not worrying about your wieght problems until level or so.  But if your insistant on getting rid of things I would reccomend
ygData.messageBody:
To be honest with you I reccomend not worrying about your wieght problems
until level or so. But if your insistant on getting rid of things I would
reccomend going to swamps and start killing froglocks for netted armor if
your in Qeynos go into the sewers and fight the froglocks down there for
some netted armor.

Dawey of th 16th circle Tunare


>From: Xurlus@...
>Reply-To: EQ-Monks@onelist.com
>To: EQ-Monks@onelist.com
>Subject: [EQ-Monks] AC and weight...
>Date: 24 Aug 1999 14:56:01 -0000
>
>From: Xurlus@...
>
>Hail all, I am a relatively new member of the EverQuest family.On the E'Chi
>world I just reached 8th lvl, moments ago actualy, And have many Q's
>regarding the intricacies of playing the ever loved Monk. I read in some of
>the recent posts about AC-weight considerations and would like to "trim the
>fat" so to speak from my armor.
>As of now I have a Leather, shirt, pants, shoulder, gloves, mask, cap, A
>cloth cape a mesh bracers and raw hide boots. Now keeping in mind that I am
>working with a tight budget, Nay, make that a VERY tight budget, what
>whould be your suggestions on what I should keep/acquire.
>Thank you for your time.
>Zarvitz
>8th lvl monk.
>
